text: Black Rock Plantation House, also known as the Allen-Love House, is a historic plantation house located near Riegelwood, Columbus County, North Carolina. It was built about 1845, and is a two-story, five-bay, braced frame I-house with Federal / Greek Revival style interior design elements. The house is sheathed in weatherboard and has a gable roof. It has a rear shed roof addition and a replacement one-story shed roofed front porch. The house was renovated in 2013. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2014. == References == Category:Plantation houses in North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Federal architecture in North Carolina Category:Greek Revival houses in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1845 Category:Houses in Columbus County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Columbus County, North Carolina
title: Black Rock Plantation House
